Components.Name: Planning and Preparation
Components.Description: Laying the foundation for the project by defining goals, selecting components, and creating plans.

Components.Name: Requirements Analysis
Components.Description: Clearly define what the robot should do. Examples: follow a line, avoid obstacles, transport objects, or be remote-controlled.

Components.Name: Component Selection
Components.Description: Select components based on requirements: chassis, drive (motors, wheels), controller (e.g., Arduino), sensors (e.g., ultrasonic), motor driver, and power supply.

Components.Name: Design and Circuit Diagram
Components.Description: Create a sketch for mechanical assembly and a detailed wiring diagram for the entire setup.

Components.Name: Set Up Workspace
Components.Description: Prepare all tools (screwdriver, soldering iron, multimeter) and components at a well-lit workspace.

Components.Name: Mechanical Assembly
Components.Description: The physical assembly of the robot body.

Components.Name: Chassis Assembly
Components.Description: Assemble the frame according to the instructions or your own design.

Components.Name: Attach Motors and Wheels
Components.Description: Secure the motors firmly and parallel to each other on the chassis and mount the wheels on the motor shafts.

Components.Name: Install Additional Components
Components.Description: Attach brackets for the controller, sensors, battery, and any optional support wheel.

Components.Name: Electrical and Electronic Integration
Components.Description: Wiring all electronic components. Important: The battery is connected last.

Components.Name: Place Controller and Motor Driver
Components.Description: Screw the microcontroller and motor driver board onto the designated spots.

Components.Name: Wire the Motor Driver
Components.Description: Connect the motors to the outputs of the motor driver and the control inputs of the driver to the controllerâ€™s digital pins.

Components.Name: Connect Sensors
Components.Description: Connect the sensors to the corresponding pins of the controller (power [VCC], ground [GND], and signal).

Components.Name: Establish Power Supply
Components.Description: Connect the battery to the power inputs of the motor driver and controller. An on/off switch is recommended.

Components.Name: Software Installation and Programming
Components.Description: Bringing the robot to life with the necessary software and logic.

Components.Name: Set Up Development Environment
Components.Description: Install the necessary software on your computer (e.g., Arduino IDE).

Components.Name: Install Libraries
Components.Description: Add any required software libraries for sensors or the motor driver.

Components.Name: Program Basic Logic
Components.Description: Write the code step by step: first read sensor values, then create motor functions, and finally combine both into a control logic.

Components.Name: Upload Code
Components.Description: Transfer the finished program to the robot's microcontroller.

Components.Name: Testing, Calibration, and Iteration
Components.Description: Ensure the robot works as expected and fix issues.

Components.Name: Module Testing
Components.Description: Test each component individually. Do the motors spin correctly? Are the sensor readings plausible?

Components.Name: Calibration
Components.Description: Adjust software values to reality, e.g., motor speeds for straight driving or threshold values for sensors.

Components.Name: Debugging
Components.Description: Systematically search for errors in mechanics, electronics, or software.

Components.Name: Iteration
Components.Description: Improve code and mechanics based on test results in a repeated cycle.

Components.Name: Finalization and Documentation
Components.Description: The final steps for a clean, safe, and well-documented project.

Components.Name: Cable Management
Components.Description: Secure and organize all cables with cable ties or spiral tubing to prevent damage and snagging.

Components.Name: Attach Enclosure
Components.Description: Optionally protect the electronics with a housing or cover.

Components.Name: Documentation
Components.Description: Comment the code, store the circuit diagram, and create a list of components for future reference.
